description: recto:  dead Christ's body in zigzag shape, with head bent back, legs bent at hips and knees, seen from PR; curly hair; verso: loose rendering of a young man's head, upper arm and hand
marks:
Mark and Inscriptions

UR, in pen and black ink:
medium: Red and white chalk (recto); red chalk (verso)
provenance: Rudolf S. Joseph (until 1986; sale, Christie's, New York, January 14, 1986, no. 71, for $4,950). [Kate Ganz, London, in 1987]. Sidney Bregman, Toronto. Sale, Christie's, London, July 6, 1993, no. 73, for Â£3,800, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1993-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: The Dead Christ (recto); Studies of a Young Man, His Arm and Hands (verso)
